The type of test prepared and administered by an agency that is independent of any postsecondary education institution and is typically used for admissions purposes. Tests provide information about prospective students and their academic qualifications relative to a national sample.
A state or outlying region where an address is located.
The American National Standards Institute (ANSI) two-digit code for the state.
The designation of a school’s poverty quartile for purposes of determining classes taught by highly qualified teachers in high and low poverty schools, according to state’s indicator of poverty.
The designation of how students secure access to age appropriate public schools, or publicly funded charter or private schools.

Type of related or ancillary services provided to a person or a group of persons within the formal educational system or offered by an outside agency which provides non-instructional services to support the general welfare of students. This includes physical and emotional health, the ability to select an appropriate course of study, admission to appropriate educational programs, and the ability to adjust to and remain in school through the completion of programs. In serving a student with an identified disability, related services include developmental, corrective, or supportive services required to ensure that the person benefits from special education.
An indication of whether a person is enrolled in a supervised clinical experience (including student teaching) as part of a teacher preparation program.
The type of examination used to assess teacher candidate's knowledge and skills.
An indication of the type of credential exam associated with a given exam score.
The name of the company that provides the examination used in the teacher education program.

An indication of whether a person completed a state-approved teacher preparation program.  The fact that a person has or has not been recommended to the state for initial certification or licensure may not be used as a criterion for determining who is a program completer.
An indication of whether a person is pursuing certification as a teacher.
The role that the Staff Member has been assigned for a Class Section.  (A teacher may have the lead responsibility for one section and serve a supporting role for another section of the same course.)
An indication of the pre-determined criteria for granting the teaching credential that a person holds.
An indication of the category of a legal document giving authorization to perform teaching assignment services.
The method of delivery of technical assistance received/provided
The type of technical assistance provided.
An indication of the technology literacy of 8th graders.
The type of communication number listed for a person.
An indicator of whether an institution has personnel positions that lead to consideration for tenure.
The scaling system used to specify the text complexity of an assessment item.
The unit of measurement for length of time for completion.
An indication of the progress made by a student toward English proficiency.
The type of Title III language instructional programs.
The type of Title III professional development utilized.
An indication that the student is participating in and served by programs under Title I, Part A of ESEA as amended.
The type of instructional services provided to students in ESEA Title I programs.
Titles of employment, official status, or rank for staff working in a Title I program.
The type of Title I program offered in the school or district.

An indication that a school is designated under state and federal regulations as being eligible for participation in programs authorized by Title I of ESEA as amended and whether it has a Title I program.
An indicator of whether the student has transferred to another institution.
A person who has successfully completed a transfer-preparatory program as defined by the state or by the institution if no official state definition exists.
The Native American tribal entity recognized and eligible to receive services from the United States Bureau of Indian Affairs to which a person is affiliated.
The trimester of pregnancy in which a child's mother began receiving prenatal health care.
A person's residency status for tuition purposes.
The component for which tuition is being charged.  It might be a time period (term, quarter, year, etc.) or it might be an entity of education (course, credit hour, etc.).
An indicator of whether or not the person is a US citizen.

An indication of the extent to which a public school offers instruction in which students and teachers are separated by time and/or location, and interaction occurs via computers and/or telecommunications technologies.
An indicator of a non-US citizen's Visa type.
Status of an examination used to measure a person's ability to see.
Method used for the collection of wage data for an employment record.
An indication of whether the wage information has been verified.
Identifies the type of weapon used during an incident.
The type of workforce and employment development program that an individual is participating in.
The type of work-based learning opportunity a student participated in.
Immunizations required by an organization or governing body.
The list of roles for a person.
Aggregated attendance counts.
The attributes of a person's attendance during a given day.
Identifies changes to the status of a role.
A rubric that may be utilized for scoring an assessment.
A service provided to a person in any of the P-20, adult education and workforce domains.
A credential held by a staff member.
Information on employment of a person by an organization.
Evaluation of a staff member's performance.
Number of years of experience for a staff member.

Information about a person's participation in a professional development activity and outcomes from that participation that may be related to a Professional Development Requirement.  The StaffProfessionalDevelopmentActivity may also be more granularly defined as a person's participation in a specific Professional Development Session, indicated by reference.
The exam and score of a person on a teaching credential exam.
Indicates that the student is excluded from calculation of value-added or growth attribution calculations used for teacher evaluation.
Employment attributes reported for workforce quarterly data.
Information on a person's participation in a workforce program.
